qas.question: What is the old Quantum  theory?

answers.text: a collection of results which predate modern quantum mechanics, but were never complete or self-consistent.

qas.question: The "fifth element" was disproved by what?

answers.text: an attempt to detect the motion of earth through the aether

context: Replacing the classical physics in use since the end of the scientific revolution, modern physics arose in the <a0_0>early 20th century<a0_0/> with the advent of quantum physics, substituting mathematical studies for experimental studies and examining equations to build a theoretical structure.[citation needed] The old quantum theory was <a1_0>a collection of results which predate modern quantum mechanics, but were never complete or self-consistent.<a1_0/> The collection of heuristic prescriptions for quantum mechanics were the first corrections to classical mechanics. Outside the realm of quantum physics, the various aether theories in classical physics, which supposed a "fifth element" such as the Luminiferous aether, were nullified by the <a2_0>Michelson-Morley experiment<a2_0/>—<a3_0>an attempt to detect the motion of earth through the aether<a3_0/>. In biology, Darwinism gained acceptance, promoting the concept of adaptation in <a4_0>the theory of natural selection.<a4_0/> The fields of geology, astronomy and psychology also made strides and gained new insights. In medicine, there were advances in medical theory and treatments.
